Title: Technical Foundation & Project Setup
Description: Encompasses all foundational work required to establish the development environment, project structure, core technical services (logging, persistence, error handling), and the installer/uninstaller. This epic ensures the project is built on a stable, scalable, and maintainable architecture.

Title: Install the game on my Windows PC
Description: As a new player, I want to run a simple, guided installer on my Windows PC so that I can get the game set up correctly and quickly, allowing me to start my first playthrough without technical frustration.
Comments: This story will be finalized in a later sprint with code signing.

Title: Scaffold Inno Setup Script and Add Basic Wizard Pages
Description: Create the initial installer.iss script. Define application metadata (AppName, AppVersion, etc.). Implement standard wizard pages: Welcome, LicenseFile, and Finished. Integrate branding assets (wizard images, icons).
Comments: Requires a placeholder game executable to package.

Title: Implement File Installation and Uninstaller Registration
Description: Configure the [Files] section of the Inno Setup script to copy the built game executable and all associated data files to the selected installation directory. Configure the script to create an entry in Windows 'Apps & features' for uninstallation.
Comments: Depends on the basic script scaffold.

Title: Implement Custom Installation Directory Page
Description: Add and configure the 'SelectDir' wizard page in the Inno Setup script. Implement logic to check for sufficient disk space on the selected drive and display an error if space is inadequate.
Comments: Depends on the basic script scaffold.

Title: Implement Desktop Shortcut Creation Task
Description: Add a 'Select Additional Tasks' page to the installer wizard. Include a single task, 'Create a desktop shortcut', which is checked by default. Configure the [Icons] section to create the shortcut pointing to the game executable if the task is selected.
Comments: Depends on the basic script scaffold.

Title: Configure UAC and Code Signing for Installer
Description: Set the `PrivilegesRequired` directive in the Inno Setup script to 'admin' to ensure it triggers a UAC prompt. Integrate the code signing certificate into the build process so the final setup.exe is digitally signed.
Comments: Requires a purchased code signing certificate.

Title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
Description: As a Windows PC user who no longer wishes to keep the game installed, I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space, ensuring my system remains clean.

Title: Implement Custom Uninstaller Logic with Pascal Script
Description: Using Inno Setup's Pascal Scripting, add code to the uninstaller to check for the existence of the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory. If it exists, display a message box asking the user if they want to delete this data.
Comments: Depends on the base uninstaller being registered.

Title: Implement Conditional Deletion of User Data
Description: In the uninstaller's Pascal Script, implement the logic that, based on the user's response from the prompt, either leaves the user data directory alone or recursively deletes it. Also, implement a check for a running instance of the game to prevent uninstallation.
Comments: Depends on the prompt being implemented.

Title: Initialize Git Repository and Define Branching Strategy
Description: Create the remote Git repository. Initialize the local repository with a standard .gitignore for Unity/.NET projects. Define and document the project's branching strategy (e.g., GitFlow with main, develop, feature branches).
Comments: This is the first task for the project.

Title: Create VS 2022 Solution and Unity Project
Description: Create the main Visual Studio 2022 solution file. Create the Unity Project for the presentation layer and a .NET 8 Class Library project for the core game logic.
Comments: Depends on the Git repository being initialized.

Title: Configure Assembly Definitions for Layered Architecture
Description: Within Unity, create Assembly Definition files to separate the code into distinct layers (e.g., Presentation, Application, Domain, Infrastructure). Configure the references between these assemblies to enforce dependency rules (e.g., Domain knows nothing of Presentation).
Comments: Depends on the projects being created.

Title: Integrate and Configure Serilog
Description: Add the Serilog NuGet package to the core logic project. Create a central LoggingService to encapsulate the logger configuration and provide a static ILogger instance for the application.

Title: Implement Structured JSON File Sink
Description: Configure Serilog to write to a file using a structured JSON formatter. The output should include standard fields like Timestamp, Level, and Message, as well as any custom context properties.

Title: Implement Log File Path Strategy
Description: Implement logic to ensure log files are always written to the correct user-specific directory: '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/logs'. The application must create this directory if it does not exist.

Title: Configure Rolling File and Retention Policy
Description: Configure the Serilog file sink with a rolling file policy that creates a new log file daily. Implement the retention policy to automatically delete log files older than 7 days or if the total log size exceeds 50 MB.

Title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
Description: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose and fix the bug.

Title: Implement Global Unhandled Exception Handler
Description: In the application's entry point, register a global exception handler (e.g., using AppDomain.CurrentDomain.UnhandledException) that will catch any exceptions not caught by other parts of the code.
Comments: This is a high-risk technical task.

Title: Design and Implement Modal Error Dialog UI
Description: Create a robust, simple Unity UI prefab for the modal error dialog. This UI must be able to be instantiated and shown even if the rest of the game's UI system has failed. It should display a title, a message, the error ID, and the log path.

Title: Implement Error ID Correlation
Description: In the global exception handler, generate a unique correlation ID (e.g., a GUID). This ID must be passed to both the Serilog logger when writing the exception details and to the UI controller for the modal error dialog to display.

Title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
Description: As a returning player, I want to access a dedicated screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games, so that I can track my performance, see my win/loss record, and feel a sense of long-term progression and achievement.

Title: Set Up SQLite and Data Access Layer (DAL)
Description: Integrate the `Microsoft.Data.Sqlite` NuGet package. Create a DAL with a repository pattern (e.g., `StatisticsRepository`) to handle all database connections, schema creation, and CRUD operations.

Title: Implement Database Backup Logic
Description: On application startup, the DAL must check the last modified timestamp of the SQLite database file. If it has changed since the last run, create a backup copy. Implement logic to retain only the three most recent backups, deleting older ones.

Title: Define and Implement Data Models and DB Schema
Description: Define the C# data models for `PlayerProfile`, `PlayerStatistic`, and `TopScore`. In the DAL, write the SQL `CREATE TABLE` statements to generate the database schema for these models.

Title: Create a player profile with a custom name
Description: As a new or returning player, I want to create a personal profile by entering a custom name, so that my game progress, historical statistics, and high scores are saved and displayed under my unique identity, enhancing my sense of ownership and achievement.

Title: Implement GetOrCreateProfile Database Logic
Description: In the `PlayerProfileRepository`, implement an atomic `GetOrCreateProfileAsync` method. This method will take a display name, first query the database for a profile with that name, and if it doesn't exist, create and insert a new record with a new GUID as the `profile_id`.

Title: Save game progress into one of several save slots
Description: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn, so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing from the same point at a later time.

Title: Implement GameState Serialization to JSON
Description: Using `System.Text.Json`, create a `SaveGameService` that can take the entire `GameState` object and serialize it into a formatted, versioned JSON string. Ensure it correctly handles all nested objects and collections.
Comments: Depends on a stable GameState model.

Title: Implement Checksum Generation for Save Files
Description: In the `SaveGameService`, after generating the JSON string, implement logic to calculate a checksum (e.g., SHA256) of the string content. The final save file must store both the JSON content and this checksum.

Title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
Description: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress without having to start over.

Title: Implement GameState Deserialization from JSON
Description: In the `SaveGameService`, create a method to read a save file, separate the checksum from the JSON content, and use `System.Text.Json` to deserialize the JSON back into a fully populated `GameState` object. Implement robust error handling for malformed JSON.

Title: Visually indicate unusable save files on the load game screen
Description: As a Returning Player, I want to see a clear, visual indication on the load game screen for any save files that are corrupted or incompatible with the current game version, so that I can immediately understand which games I can no longer play and avoid the frustration of attempting to load a broken save file.

Title: Implement Save File Validation Logic
Description: In the `SaveGameService`, create a method that, given a file path, reads the file, recalculates the checksum of its JSON content, and compares it to the stored checksum. This method should return a status (e.g., Valid, Corrupted).

Title: Implement Data Migration Service Stub and Interface
Description: Create the architecture for the data migration system. Define an `IDataMigrator` interface and a `DataMigrationManager` service that can be called when an older version save file is detected. Implement a placeholder migrator for a hypothetical v1 to v2.

Title: Implement Save File Versioning Read/Write Logic
Description: Modify the `SaveGameService` to include a `gameVersion` property in the root of the JSON save file. When loading, the service must read this version number before full deserialization to determine if migration is needed.

Title: Implement PlayerState Data Model
Description: Create the `PlayerState.cs` class in the core logic project. It must contain all fields as specified in REQ-1-031, including player_id, cash, properties_owned, current_position, status, etc., with appropriate data types and enums.

Title: Implement GameState Data Model
Description: Create the `GameState.cs` class. This will be the top-level container for a game session. It must contain a list of `PlayerState` objects, the `boardState` (property ownership/development), `bankState`, `deckStates`, and other metadata as per REQ-1-041.

Title: Set Up NUnit Test Projects
Description: Create separate .NET 8 NUnit test projects for the core logic layers (Domain, Application). Configure the main solution to include and run these tests.

Title: Establish and Enforce C# Coding Conventions
Description: Configure the solution with a `.editorconfig` file that enforces the Microsoft C# Coding Conventions. Integrate a linter/analyzer into the IDE (Visual Studio) to provide real-time feedback on convention violations.

Title: Start a new game from the main menu
Description: As a player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.

Title: Implement Main Menu UI Shell
Description: Create the main menu scene in Unity. Design and implement the UI layout with placeholders for buttons: 'New Game', 'Load Game', 'Settings', 'Quit'. Ensure the visual style is consistent with the game's branding.

Title: Implement Scene Management Service
Description: Create a singleton or service locator pattern for managing scene transitions. It should provide a simple API like `LoadSceneAsync(sceneName)` that handles loading screens and asynchronous scene loading.

Title: Wire Up 'New Game' Button
Description: Implement the `OnClick` handler for the 'New Game' button on the main menu. This handler should call the Scene Management Service to transition the player to the Game Setup scene.

Title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
Description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents from a choice of one, two, or three, so that I can customize the game's challenge, duration, and overall experience to my preference.

Title: Implement Game Setup UI Shell
Description: Create the game setup scene in Unity. Design the layout with areas for player profile entry, token selection, and AI opponent configuration.

Title: Implement AI Opponent Count Selector
Description: In the game setup UI, add a control (e.g., a segmented control or +/- buttons) to select the number of AI opponents (1, 2, or 3). Implement logic to dynamically show/hide the configuration sections for each AI based on this selection.

Title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
Description: As a player setting up my profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid, so that I can easily correct it and proceed to start the game without frustration.

Title: Implement Real-time Profile Name Validation in UI
Description: Add an `OnValueChanged` listener to the profile name input field. This listener should call a validation service in real-time. The UI must display/hide specific error messages for length and invalid characters, and enable/disable the 'Start Game' button based on validity.

Title: Implement Profile Name Input UI
Description: On the game setup screen, add a labeled text input field for the player to enter their profile name. Include a text area below it for displaying validation error messages.

Title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
Description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity and feel more connected to the game experience.

Title: Implement Token Selector UI Component
Description: Create a UI component that displays a grid of selectable token icons. Implement the selection logic so that clicking a token highlights it and deselects any other. The selected token's ID must be stored in a game setup data model.
Comments: Requires 2D token icon assets.

Title: Implement AI Token Random Assignment Logic
Description: When the 'Start Game' button is clicked, implement logic that takes the human player's chosen token, creates a list of the remaining available tokens, and randomly assigns a unique token from that list to each AI opponent.

Title: Set a unique difficulty level for each AI opponent
Description: As a Human Player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each of my AI opponents so that I can customize the game's challenge to match my skill level and desired experience, enhancing replayability.

Title: Implement AI Difficulty Selector UI
Description: For each AI opponent configuration section, add a UI control (e.g., dropdown, set of buttons) to select its difficulty ('Easy', 'Medium', 'Hard'). The selected difficulty for each AI must be stored in the game setup data model. The default selection should be 'Medium'.

Title: Access an in-game settings menu
Description: As a player in the middle of a game, I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match, so that I can adjust game options, save my progress, or exit the game in a controlled manner.

Title: Implement Pause Menu UI Shell
Description: Create a UI prefab for the in-game pause menu. It should be a modal overlay that partially obscures the game board. Add buttons for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', 'Return to Main Menu', and 'Quit'.

Title: Implement Game Pause and Resume Logic
Description: Create a `GamePauser` service that can freeze and unfreeze the game's time scale and block player input. The service should be invoked when the pause menu is opened and closed. Ensure AI logic is also suspended.

Title: Implement Pause Menu Navigation
Description: Wire up the `OnClick` handlers for the buttons on the pause menu. 'Resume' should close the menu and unpause the game. 'Settings' should navigate to a sub-panel. 'Return to Main Menu' and 'Quit' should have confirmation dialogs before executing.

Title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD
Description: As a player, I want a persistent on-screen display showing the name, token, and current cash for every player, so that I can instantly assess the financial standing of my opponents and myself to make better strategic decisions throughout the game.

Title: Design and Implement HUD UI Shell
Description: In the main game scene, create the canvas and layout for the Heads-Up Display. Position anchor points for 2, 3, and 4 player panels to ensure they fit correctly without overlapping the board view.

Title: Create Dynamic Player Panel UI Prefab
Description: Create a UI prefab for a single player's information panel. This prefab must include elements for the player's name, token icon, and cash balance. It should also have a visual element (e.g., a border) that can be toggled to indicate the active turn.

Title: Implement HUD Data Binding and Event Listeners
Description: Create a `HUDController` that instantiates the correct number of player panels at game start. The controller must subscribe to game events (e.g., `OnTurnChanged`, `OnPlayerCashChanged`, `OnPlayerBankrupt`) and update the corresponding UI elements in real-time.

Title: Ensure UI and Game View Adapt to Different Monitor Aspect Ratios
Description: As a PC gamer with a monitor of any common aspect ratio, I want the game's user interface and 3D view to automatically adapt to my screen's dimensions so that I can play the game without any visual distortion, overlapping elements, or loss of critical information, ensuring a high-quality and fully functional experience.

Title: Configure Unity Canvas Scaler for Responsive UI
Description: Set up the root UI Canvas with a `CanvasScaler` component configured to 'Scale With Screen Size'. Establish a reference resolution (e.g., 1920x1080) and set the match mode to balance between width and height.

Title: Implement Anchoring for Main Menu and Setup Screens
Description: Review and update all UI elements on the Main Menu and Game Setup screens to use proper anchoring. Ensure that elements anchored to corners/edges stay there, and centered elements remain centered across 16:9, 16:10, and 21:9 aspect ratios.

Title: Implement Anchoring for In-Game HUD
Description: Apply responsive anchoring to the in-game HUD and its player panels. Ensure that the panels stick to their designated corners of the screen and do not overlap the central game board area on any supported aspect ratio.

Title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
Description: As a human player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice, so that I can determine the number of spaces my token will move and proceed with my turn.

Title: Implement 'Roll Dice' Button UI and State Logic
Description: Create the 'Roll Dice' button in the main game UI. Implement the logic to enable this button only during the human player's 'Pre-Roll Management Phase' and disable it at all other times.

Title: Create Secure Random Number Generation Service
Description: Implement a dice rolling service that uses a cryptographically secure random number generator (e.g., `System.Security.Cryptography.RandomNumberGenerator`) to produce two independent integers between 1 and 6, as per REQ-1-042.

Title: Create 3D Dice Roll Animation
Description: Develop the visual effect for the dice roll. This includes creating or integrating 3D models for the dice and implementing either a physics-based or a pre-canned animation that shows the dice tumbling and landing on their final values. The animation must be skippable based on game speed settings.

Title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
Description: As a player, I want to see my game token animate its movement from one space to the next after I roll the dice, so that I can visually track my progress around the board and have an immersive, intuitive gameplay experience.

Title: Map Board Spaces to 3D World Coordinates
Description: Create a data structure (e.g., a ScriptableObject or array in a manager class) that maps each of the 40 logical board space indices to a precise `Vector3` position in the Unity scene where a token should be placed.

Title: Implement Token Movement Animation Logic
Description: Create a coroutine or tween-based animation system that takes a starting space index and a number of spaces to move. The system must animate the player's token prefab from one coordinate to the next sequentially until it reaches the destination. The speed must be tied to the game speed setting.

Title: Implement Camera Follow for Token Movement
Description: Create a script for the main camera that smoothly follows the active player's token as it moves around the board. The camera should pan and possibly zoom to keep the token centered and in view during its movement animation.

Title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
Description: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice, so that I can proactively adjust my financial position and property development to prepare for the opportunities and risks of my upcoming move.

Title: Implement Game Turn State Machine
Description: Design and implement a formal state machine to manage the phases of a player's turn (Pre-Turn, Pre-Roll Management, Roll, Movement, Action, Post-Roll). This service will be the central controller for game flow.
Comments: This is a critical, high-complexity architectural task.

Title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
Description: As a player (human or AI), I want to be granted an immediate, additional turn after I roll doubles, so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules and provides an authentic gameplay experience.

Title: Implement Doubles Counter and Extra Turn Logic
Description: Within the Turn State Machine, add logic to check the result of a dice roll. If it's a double, increment a per-turn counter on the active `PlayerState`. In the 'Post-Roll' phase, if the doubles counter is 1 or 2, transition the state back to 'Pre-Roll Management' for the same player.

Title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
Description: As a player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn, so that the game correctly enforces the official rules and maintains the strategic balance of risk and reward associated with rolling doubles.

Title: Implement 'Three Doubles to Jail' Rule
Description: In the Turn State Machine's post-roll check, if a third consecutive double is detected, immediately end the current player's turn sequence, set their `status` to `InJail`, and move their token directly to the Jail space. Ensure no movement from the dice roll occurs.

Title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
Description: As a Player, I want my cash balance to be automatically credited with a $200 salary so that the game correctly follows the official rules and I receive the funds I am entitled to for completing a lap of the board.

Title: Implement 'Pass Go' Salary Logic
Description: In the Movement phase of the turn, after calculating the destination space, check if the token's path has crossed from a high index (e.g., >10) to a low index (<10). If so, credit the active player's cash with $200. This must not trigger on a direct 'Go to Jail' move.

Title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
Description: As a player, I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules and I can continue my turn without manual calculations.

Title: Implement Luxury Tax Space Action
Description: In the Action phase of the turn, if the player has landed on the Luxury Tax space, automatically deduct the fixed tax amount from their cash. This will require integration with the bankruptcy flow if funds are insufficient.

Title: Experience no gameplay effect when landing on Free Parking
Description: As a player, I want the game to apply no special action when my token lands on the Free Parking space so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules and my turn proceeds correctly.

Title: Implement Free Parking Space Action (No-Op)
Description: In the Action phase of the turn, if the player has landed on Free Parking, the logic should perform no operation and simply transition to the Post-Roll phase.

Title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
Description: As a property owner, I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the game rules are enforced fairly and I can focus on my strategy without manually managing transactions.

Title: Automatically pay rent when I land on an opponent's property
Description: As a player, I want the game to automatically calculate and process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property, so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly without manual intervention.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Implement Rent Calculation Engine
Description: Create a service that takes a property ID and the current GameState as input and returns the correct rent amount. This engine must account for monopoly ownership (doubled rent), development level (houses/hotels), number of railroads owned, and dice roll for utilities.

Title: Implement Rent Transaction Logic
Description: In the Action phase of the turn, if a player lands on an owned property, use the Rent Calculation Engine to determine the rent. Execute the atomic transaction of debiting the renter and crediting the owner. Integrate with the bankruptcy flow if the renter cannot pay.

Title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% of my net worth for Income Tax
Description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear choice between paying a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth when I land on the Income Tax space, so that I can make the most strategic financial decision to preserve my cash and improve my chances of winning, in accordance with the official game rules.

Title: Implement Net Worth Calculator Service
Description: Create a service that can calculate a player's total net worth at any time. The calculation must sum cash, the printed value of all owned properties (including mortgaged ones), and the purchase price of all buildings.

Title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
Description: As a human player, I want the game to pause and display a focused, interactive pop-up for critical, turn-halting decisions, so that I can consciously evaluate my options and make informed choices without the risk of missing important game events.

Title: Develop a Reusable Modal Dialog System
Description: Create a generic, prefab-based modal dialog system. It should support a title, body content, and a dynamic number of action buttons. The system must be able to block background UI interactions and provide callbacks for button clicks.

Title: Implement Income Tax Dialog UI
Description: Using the modal dialog system, create the specific UI for the Income Tax choice. The UI controller must call the Net Worth Calculator service, format the two choices ('Pay $200' and 'Pay 10% ($XXX)'), and display them on the buttons.

Title: Choose to buy an unowned property I land on
Description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear, informative prompt when I land on an unowned property, giving me the option to purchase it for its listed price, so that I can strategically acquire assets, build monopolies, and progress towards winning the game.

Title: Implement Buy/Auction Property Dialog UI
Description: Using the modal dialog system, create the UI for the property purchase decision. It must display a visual of the property card, the player's current cash, and buttons for 'Buy' (with price) and 'Auction'. The 'Buy' button must be disabled if the player has insufficient funds.

Title: Implement Buy Property Transaction Logic
Description: Implement the backend logic for when a player clicks 'Buy'. This involves an atomic transaction that debits the player's cash and adds the property deed to their list of owned properties. Fire an event to notify the UI to update.

Title: Choose to send an unowned property to auction instead of buying it
Description: As a Human Player, I want the option to decline the immediate purchase of an unowned property I land on so that I can trigger an auction for that property, allowing me to either acquire it for a lower price or force other players to spend their cash.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Participate in an auction for a property
Description: As a Human Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I have a strategic opportunity to acquire properties that were not purchased outright and can compete to complete my sets or block my opponents.

Title: Implement Property Auction UI
Description: Create a new modal UI for the auction process. It must display the property being auctioned, the current high bidder and bid amount, and provide controls for the human player to 'Place Bid' or 'Withdraw'.

Title: Implement Auction State Machine
Description: Create a service to manage the auction flow. It must handle the clockwise bidding order, track which players have withdrawn, determine the winner when only one bidder remains, and process the final sale transaction.

Title: Implement AI Bidding Logic Stub
Description: Create a basic AI bidding strategy. For this initial version, the AI will simply bid if the current price is less than a certain percentage (e.g., 120%) of the property's list price and if it has sufficient cash. This will be expanded upon in the main AI stories.

Title: Adjust master, music, and sound effect volumes independently
Description: As a player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels so that I can customize the game's audio to my personal preference for a more enjoyable experience.

Title: Set Up Unity AudioMixer
Description: Create a Unity AudioMixer with three main groups: Master, Music, and SFX. Expose the volume parameter for each group so it can be controlled via script.

Title: Implement Volume Sliders UI
Description: In the settings menu, add three slider controls, one for each audio group. The sliders should be labeled clearly. Implement the `OnValueChanged` listeners for each slider.

Title: Implement Audio Settings Persistence
Description: Create a service to save and load audio settings to a local config file (e.g., JSON). When a slider value changes, save it immediately. On game startup, load the saved values and apply them to the AudioMixer and the UI sliders.

Title: Draw a Chance card when landing on a Chance space
Description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Chance space, so that the game follows the official rules and introduces the element of luck and surprise that is core to the Monopoly experience.

Title: Draw a Community Chest card when landing on a Community Chest space
Description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Community Chest space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules of Monopoly and the game state is updated accordingly without manual effort.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Implement Card Deck Manager Service
Description: Create a `DeckManager` service that initializes the Chance and Community Chest decks at the start of a new game. It must shuffle the decks and provide methods to `DrawCard(deckType)` and `ReturnCardToBottom(card, deckType)`.

Title: Define Card Data Schema and Load from JSON
Description: Create a JSON file that defines all Chance and Community Chest cards, including their text and an action type/parameter (e.g., `{"action": "AddMoney", "amount": 50}`). Implement a loader to parse this file into a list of card data objects at runtime.

Title: Implement Card Action System (Command Pattern)
Description: Create an action system (e.g., using the Command Pattern) to execute the effects of cards. Define an `ICardAction` interface and create concrete classes for each action type (AddMoney, MovePlayer, GoToJail, etc.). A factory will create the correct action object based on the card's data.

Title: Implement Card Display UI
Description: Create a modal UI prefab to display a drawn card. The UI should show the card's text and artwork and have a 'Continue' button for the human player to acknowledge it. For AI players, this UI should appear as a smaller, non-intrusive, auto-dismissing notification.

Title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
Description: As a player who is in jail, I want to be presented with the option to pay a $50 fine at the beginning of my turn, so that I can immediately get out of jail and continue my turn normally, allowing me to maintain momentum in the game.

Title: Get out of jail by using a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
Description: As a player who is in jail and owns a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, I want to be presented with the option to use it at the start of my turn, so that I can get out of jail immediately without spending money or relying on a lucky dice roll.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
Description: As a player in jail, I want to choose the option to roll the dice on my turn, so that I can attempt to get out of jail for free by rolling doubles, preserving my cash and 'Get Out of Jail Free' cards.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Implement Core Jail State Logic
Description: In the Turn State Machine, implement the 'Pre-Turn' phase logic for a jailed player. This includes checking `jail_turns_remaining` and presenting the available options (Pay, Use Card, Roll). Implement the state change from `InJail` to `Active`.

Title: Implement 'Jail Options' UI
Description: Create a modal dialog UI that is displayed at the start of a jailed player's turn. It must dynamically show the available options ('Pay $50 Fine', 'Use Card', 'Roll for Doubles') as buttons. Buttons for actions the player cannot take (e.g., pay with no cash) must be disabled.

Title: Implement 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card' Logic
Description: Implement the backend logic for using a GOJF card. This must decrement the player's card count, set their status to Active, and call the `DeckManager` to return the card to the bottom of its original deck.

Title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
Description: As a human player managing my in-game assets, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view the status of all my properties and take strategic actions like building or mortgaging from a single, consolidated interface.

Title: Implement Property Management UI Shell
Description: Create a new modal screen for property management. The layout should include a scrollable area for property cards and a persistent display of the player's current cash. Include a 'Close' button.

Title: Create Dynamic Property Card UI Prefab
Description: Design and implement a UI prefab for a single property card. It must display the property's name, color group, development level (icons for houses/hotel), mortgage status, and have a container for action buttons (Build, Mortgage, etc.).

Title: Implement Property Management UI Data Binding
Description: Create a `PropertyManagementController` that, when the UI is opened, reads the current player's `properties_owned` list. For each property, it instantiates a property card prefab and populates it with the correct data and visual state (e.g., mortgaged overlay).

Title: Build houses on properties in a complete color set
Description: As a player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties so that I can increase the rent value and gain a strategic advantage over my opponents.

Title: Enforce even building rule for property development
Description: As a player who owns a complete property set (a monopoly), I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I try to purchase or sell houses, so that the game is fair, follows official Monopoly rules, and maintains its strategic economic balance.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Upgrade a set of 4 houses to a single hotel
Description: As a strategic player who has acquired a full monopoly and developed it with four houses on each property, I want to purchase a hotel for each of those properties, returning the four houses to the bank, so that I can charge the maximum possible rent and increase my chances of winning the game.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Implement Core Building Transaction Logic
Description: Create a `BuildingService` that handles the atomic transaction of purchasing a building. It must check for sufficient player cash, debit the player, and decrement the available building supply from the `BankState`.

Title: Implement 'Even Building' Rule Validator
Description: In the `BuildingService`, before executing a purchase, create a validation method that checks the 'even building' rule. It must take a property and compare its house count to all other properties in the same color group owned by the player.

Title: Implement Hotel Upgrade Logic
Description: Extend the `BuildingService` to handle hotel purchases. This logic must verify that all properties in the monopoly have 4 houses. The transaction must correctly return 4 houses to the bank's supply while decrementing 1 hotel.

Title: Implement Build/Sell Button Logic in UI
Description: On the property card prefab, implement the `OnClick` handlers for 'Build House', 'Sell House', and 'Build Hotel' buttons. These handlers will call the `BuildingService`. The controller must also dynamically enable/disable these buttons based on the validation rules (even building, cash, bank supply).

Title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
Description: As a player managing my finances, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties to the Bank, so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts, fund purchases, or avoid bankruptcy.

Title: Unmortgage a property by paying the principal plus 10% interest
Description: As a Human Player managing my assets, I want to pay the bank to unmortgage one of my properties so that I can start collecting rent on it again and enable future development.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Implement Mortgage/Unmortgage Transaction Logic
Description: Create a `MortgageService` to handle the logic. The `Mortgage` method credits the player with the mortgage value and sets the property's state. The `Unmortgage` method debits the player for the value + 10% interest and clears the state. Both must be atomic.

Title: Implement Mortgage/Unmortgage Button Logic in UI
Description: On the property card prefab, add 'Mortgage' and 'Unmortgage' buttons. The UI controller must show/hide these buttons based on the property's current mortgage status and enable/disable them based on player funds and game rules (e.g., cannot mortgage with buildings).

Title: Be forced to pay the fine after failing to roll doubles for 3 turns in jail
Description: As a player in jail for my third consecutive turn, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine if I fail to roll doubles, so that the official game rules are enforced and my turn can proceed correctly.

Title: Implement Forced Jail Payment Logic
Description: In the jail state logic, on the player's final turn, if the roll is not doubles, automatically trigger a $50 payment transaction. If the player has insufficient funds, the logic must trigger the bankruptcy/asset liquidation flow before allowing the player to move.

Title: Notify player of building shortage when attempting to build
Description: As a player trying to develop my properties, I want to receive a clear, immediate notification when I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels, so that I understand the game state and can adjust my strategy without thinking the game is broken.

Title: Implement Building Shortage Rule
Description: In the `BuildingService`, add a validation check at the beginning of any purchase request to ensure the bank's supply for the requested building type is greater than zero. If not, the transaction is rejected.

Title: Integrate Management Actions into Pre-Roll Phase
Description: In the Turn State Machine, ensure that the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase' correctly enables the UI for property management (building, mortgaging) and trading. When the 'Roll Dice' action is triggered, ensure all these management UIs are disabled.

Title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
Description: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct, review, and understand trade offers to make strategic decisions effectively.

Title: Design and Implement Trade UI Shell
Description: Create the modal UI for trading. It must have two main panels ('Your Offer', 'Their Offer'), sections to display each player's available assets, and a footer for action buttons ('Propose Trade', 'Cancel').

Title: Implement Asset Selection and Offer Panel Logic
Description: Develop the logic for the trade UI. Clicking an asset in a player's inventory list should move it to the corresponding offer panel. Clicking an asset in an offer panel should return it to the inventory. The UI must update in real-time.

Title: Define and Implement Trade Offer Data Model
Description: Create a `TradeOffer` class that can store the state of a pending trade. It should contain lists of properties, cash amounts, and GOJF cards for both the proposing player and the target player.

Title: Implement Player-Initiated Trade Flow
Description: Wire up the 'Propose Trade' button. When clicked, it should package the current state of the UI panels into a `TradeOffer` object and send it to the AI's decision-making service for evaluation.

Title: Implement Behavior Tree Framework
Description: Integrate a Behavior Tree library or create a simple, custom framework. This includes defining the core node types (Sequence, Selector, Action, Condition) and an executor that can tick the tree.

Title: Implement AI Configuration Loader
Description: Create a service that reads the `ai_config.json` file at runtime. This service will parse the parameters for each difficulty level and provide them to the AI agent on initialization.

Title: Implement Basic AI Turn Executor
Description: Create an `AIAgent` class that can execute a full turn. For this initial version, it will simply perform mandatory actions: get out of jail if forced, roll the dice, and handle the landing space action (e.g., automatically buy affordable properties). No complex strategy.

Title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
Description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear, interactive dialog when an AI opponent proposes a trade, showing exactly what is being offered and requested, so that I can evaluate the strategic value of the deal and make an informed decision to either accept or decline it.

Title: Implement AI Trade Proposal Dialog
Description: When the game receives a trade offer event from an AI, it should pause and display the two-panel trade UI. The UI must be pre-populated with the AI's offer and present the human player with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' buttons.

Title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
Description: As a strategic player negotiating with an AI, I want to respond to their trade proposal with a modified counter-offer, so that I can fine-tune the deal to better suit my strategic goals instead of being limited to a simple accept or decline.

Title: Implement Counter-Offer Flow Logic
Description: Wire up the 'Propose Counter-Offer' button. When clicked, the UI should transition from the 'Accept/Decline' state to the editable 'Propose/Cancel' state, allowing the user to modify the pre-populated offer and submit it back to the AI.

Title: Develop AI Property Valuation Model
Description: Create a service that the AI can use to determine the value of any given property. The valuation should be more sophisticated than the list price, taking into account its potential to form a monopoly for the AI or for an opponent.

Title: Develop AI Trade Evaluation Logic
Description: Create the core Behavior Tree nodes for evaluating a trade offer. This logic must use the valuation model to compare the value of assets offered vs. assets requested and make a decision based on its difficulty setting (e.g., 'Easy' AI accepts bad trades).

Title: Develop AI Property Purchase/Auction Strategy
Description: Create BT nodes for deciding whether to buy a property outright or how high to bid in an auction. The logic should be influenced by the AI's cash, the property's value (from the valuation model), and its difficulty level.

Title: Develop AI Building Strategy
Description: Create BT nodes for deciding when and where to build houses/hotels. The 'Hard' AI should prioritize building on high-value monopolies and potentially try to create a housing shortage.

Title: Develop AI Mortgage Strategy
Description: Create BT nodes for deciding when to mortgage properties to raise cash. A 'Hard' AI should mortgage low-value properties first, while an 'Easy' AI might make suboptimal choices.

Title: Receive a non-intrusive notification when AI players trade with each other
Description: As a human player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when a trade is completed between two AI opponents, so that I can maintain situational awareness of the game's strategic landscape and make more informed decisions.

Title: Implement AI-to-AI Trade Notification UI
Description: Create a non-intrusive 'toast' notification UI prefab. It should have a simple layout to display text and should animate in and out of the screen without pausing the game.

Title: Implement Trade Completed Event Listener
Description: The `HUDController` or a dedicated `NotificationManager` must subscribe to a `TradeCompleted` event. When an event between two AI players is received, it should trigger the toast notification with a formatted summary of the trade.

Title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
Description: As a strategic player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a building shortage, so that I have a fair, rule-compliant chance to acquire these critical assets and gain a competitive advantage.

Title: Implement Building Shortage Auction Logic
Description: When a build request is made and a building shortage is detected, the `BuildingService` must trigger a special building auction instead of a direct sale. This requires creating a new auction flow, similar to the property auction, but for individual buildings. The AI must be able to participate.
Comments: This is a high-complexity task involving rules, UI, and AI.

Title: Create Curated Test Save Game Files
Description: Develop a suite of predefined save game files (.json) as test assets. These files must set up specific scenarios for testing edge cases like a player near bankruptcy, a housing shortage, and complex property ownership, as per REQ-1-027.

Title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
Description: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game and am no longer an active participant.

Title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining
Description: As a human player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a distinct and celebratory victory screen, so that my achievement is acknowledged and I feel a sense of accomplishment, encouraging me to play again.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: View a detailed game summary screen after a match ends
Description: As a Human Player who has just completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen so that I can review the performance of all players, understand the final outcome, and feel a sense of closure for the match.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Implement Bankruptcy Rule Engine
Description: Create a `BankruptcyService` that can determine if a player can cover a debt. It must calculate the total liquidatable assets (cash + half value of buildings + mortgage value of properties). If total assets are less than the debt, the player is bankrupt.

Title: Implement Asset Transfer Logic (Player to Player)
Description: When a player is bankrupted by another player, implement the logic to transfer all their assets (cash, properties, GOJF cards) to the creditor player. Mortgaged properties must be transferred in their mortgaged state.

Title: Implement Asset Transfer Logic (Player to Bank)
Description: When a player is bankrupted by the Bank, implement the logic to return all their properties to the Bank. Immediately after, these properties must be auctioned off one by one to the remaining players.

Title: Implement Win/Loss Condition Check
Description: In the `TurnManager`, after any bankruptcy event, check the number of non-bankrupt players remaining. If the count is 1, trigger the game-end sequence. If the remaining player is human, trigger a win; otherwise, continue until an AI wins.

Title: Implement High-Speed AI Simulation Mode
Description: When the human player loses, the `TurnManager` must enter a high-speed simulation mode. This mode should execute AI turns instantly by processing only the game logic and skipping all animations and delays until a single AI winner is determined.

Title: Implement Game Over and Victory Screen UI
Description: Create the UI screens for the win and lose conditions. The Victory screen should be celebratory and show key stats. The Game Over screen should be more subdued and guide the user to the game summary.

Title: Implement Game Summary Screen UI
Description: Create the final game summary screen. It must dynamically create a panel for each player (2-4) and display their final stats, clearly highlighting the winner and the human player's rank. Include a 'Return to Main Menu' button.

Title: Implement Save Game UI Screen
Description: Create the 'Save Game' UI screen, accessible from the pause menu. It should display 5 slots. For each existing save file, it must read the file's metadata (player name, timestamp) and display it. Empty slots should be marked as such. Implement the overwrite confirmation dialog.

Title: Implement Load Game UI Screen
Description: Create the 'Load Game' screen, accessible from the main menu. It should display the 5 save slots, showing metadata for valid saves and 'Empty' for unused slots. It will be updated later to show corrupted/incompatible states.

Title: Update Load Game UI for Invalid States
Description: Modify the 'Load Game' screen and its controller to handle the 'Corrupted' and 'Incompatible' statuses returned by the validation service. The UI must display the correct label, apply a visual distinction (e.g., grey out), and disable the 'Load' button for these slots.

Title: Implement Statistics Aggregation Logic
Description: At the end of a game, create logic that takes the final `GameState` and updates the persistent `PlayerStatistic` record in the database. This includes incrementing `totalGamesPlayed`, `totalWins` (if applicable), and updating averages and other aggregate metrics. This must be a transactional database operation.

Title: Implement Player Statistics UI Screen
Description: Create the UI screen to display historical statistics. The screen controller must fetch the `PlayerStatistic` data from the repository for the current profile and populate the text fields on screen. Handle the case where no stats exist yet.

Title: View a list of my top 10 victories
Description: As a competitive player who tracks my performance, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen from the main menu, so that I can review my most successful victories, see how I'm improving, and be motivated to beat my own records.

Title: Implement High Score Update and Query Logic
Description: At the end of a winning game, implement logic to check if the player's final net worth qualifies for the top 10. If so, insert the new record and delete the 11th record. Create a repository method to query the top 10 scores, correctly sorted by net worth then turns.

Title: Implement High Score UI Screen
Description: Create the UI screen for the Top Scores list. It must feature a table or scrollable list that displays the top 10 entries fetched from the database, formatted for readability. Handle the case where no scores exist.

Title: Export my top score history to a text file
Description: As a competitive player who tracks my performance, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple, human-readable text file, so that I can easily share my achievements with friends or keep a personal record of my best games outside of the application.

Title: Implement High Score Export Logic
Description: On the High Score UI, add an 'Export' button. Its handler should fetch the top 10 scores, format them into a human-readable string, open a native Windows 'Save File' dialog, and write the string to the user-selected text file.

Title: Adjust the game speed to make animations faster or instant
Description: As an experienced player, I want to change the game speed setting so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions, allowing for a faster-paced game.

Title: Implement Game Speed Controller
Description: Create a central `GameSpeedController` service that manages animation speed multipliers and AI thinking delays. All animations (dice, token movement) and AI delays must be refactored to query this service for their duration. Implement the auction override logic.

Title: Implement Game Speed UI Controls
Description: In the settings menu, add a control (e.g., radio buttons) for selecting the game speed ('Normal', 'Fast', 'Instant'). This control should update the `GameSpeedController` and have its state persisted via the settings persistence service.

Title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
Description: As a Data-Conscious Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores after a confirmation prompt, so that I can have a clean slate and start tracking my performance from scratch.

Title: Provide a bulk deletion option for all saved games via the settings menu
Description: As a user who wants to manage my game data, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, with a confirmation step, so that I can easily clear out old progress and start fresh without having to manually find and delete files on my computer.
Comments: EPIC-001

Title: Implement Data Management Buttons and Confirmation UI
Description: In the settings menu, add buttons for 'Reset Statistics' and 'Delete Saved Games'. Implement a generic confirmation dialog that can be triggered by these buttons, warning the user of the permanent, destructive action.

Title: Implement Reset Statistics Logic
Description: Create a method in the `StatisticsRepository` to delete all records from the `PlayerStatistic` and `TopScore` tables for the current profile. This must be a single, atomic transaction. Wire this method to the confirmation dialog.

Title: Implement Delete All Saves Logic
Description: Create a method in a file management service that iterates through all files in the `.../saves` directory and deletes them. Wrap this in error handling. Wire this method to the confirmation dialog.

Title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
Description: As a player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes for the game, so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh and engaging over multiple playthroughs.

Title: Implement Theme Manager Service
Description: Create a `ThemeManager` service that is responsible for tracking the current theme and handling the switch. It will hold references to all themeable components in the game.

Title: Integrate Addressable Asset System for Theme Assets
Description: Set up the Unity Addressables system. Organize all theme-specific assets (UI sprites, board textures, token prefabs, audio clips) into labeled groups so they can be loaded dynamically by the `ThemeManager`.

Title: Implement Theme Selection UI in Settings
Description: In the settings menu, create a UI for selecting a theme. It should display a preview image and name for each available theme and allow the user to apply their selection.

Title: Refactor UI Systems for Theming
Description: Refactor UI components (buttons, panels, HUD) to no longer use hard-coded asset references. Instead, they must request their sprites and fonts from the `ThemeManager` based on the active theme.

Title: Refactor Board and Token Rendering for Theming
Description: Refactor the board and token instantiation logic. The `BoardManager` must request the appropriate 3D models and materials from the `ThemeManager` at the start of the game and when a theme is switched.

Title: Refactor Audio System for Theming
Description: Refactor the `AudioManager`. Instead of holding direct references to audio clips, it must request them from the `ThemeManager`. This applies to both background music and sound effects.

Title: Start an optional interactive tutorial to learn the game
Description: As a new player, I want to start an optional, interactive tutorial so that I can learn the basic rules and game controls in a guided, hands-on environment before playing a full game.

Title: Implement Tutorial Scripting Engine
Description: Design and build a data-driven tutorial engine. It should be able to read a sequence of steps from a script file (e.g., JSON). Each step defines what to wait for (e.g., a button click), which UI element to highlight, and what scripted game event to trigger next.

Title: Implement UI Highlighting and Input Blocking System
Description: Create a system that can draw a highlight (e.g., a glowing outline) around a specific UI element and block all input except to that element. This is the core mechanism for guiding the user through the tutorial.

Title: Create and Implement Tutorial Script Content
Description: Write the actual tutorial script as a data file. The script must cover the fundamental actions: rolling dice, moving, buying property, and receiving rent. This involves defining the sequence of events and writing the instructional text for each step.

Title: Access and search a digital rulebook from game menus
Description: As a player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from both the main menu and the in-game pause menu so that I can quickly find and clarify specific game rules without leaving the application.

Title: Implement Rulebook UI
Description: Create a modal UI for the rulebook. It should feature a search bar at the top and a scrollable text area for the content. The layout must be clean and optimized for reading.

Title: Implement Rulebook Data Loader
Description: Write logic to load the rulebook content from an external structured JSON file. The JSON should define sections, rules, and sub-rules, which the loader will parse into a data structure for the UI to display.

Title: Implement Rulebook Search Functionality
Description: Implement the logic for the search bar. As the user types, it should filter the displayed rules in real-time, showing only those sections/rules that contain the search term. The search term should be highlighted in the results.

Title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
Description: As a Game Player, I want to be notified in a non-intrusive way when a new version of the game is available upon startup, so that I can easily access the latest features, bug fixes, and improvements without having to manually check for updates.

Title: Implement Update Checker Service
Description: Implement a basic, non-blocking service that, on startup, makes an asynchronous web request to a defined URL to check for updates. It will handle success and silent failure cases.
Comments: This task was initially a stub, this makes it production-ready.

Title: Implement Update Notification UI
Description: Create the non-intrusive UI element on the main menu to display when an update is available. This UI must contain a clickable link or button that opens the game's download URL in the user's default web browser.

Title: View the game's data privacy statement
Description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to access and read a clear data privacy statement from the main menu, so that I can understand what data the game collects, how it is stored, and confirm that it operates entirely offline, which builds my trust in the application.

Title: Implement Data Privacy Statement UI and Loader
Description: Create a simple UI panel with a scrollable text area to display the privacy policy. Implement logic to load the policy text from an external resource file (e.g., a .txt file in Resources) and populate the text area.
Comments: This task was initially a stub, this finalizes it with content.

Title: Create Core Logic and Rule Engine Unit Test Suite
Description: Write a comprehensive suite of NUnit tests for the core game logic, especially the Rule Engine. Achieve a minimum of 70% code coverage for these critical, non-UI components. The tests must cover property transactions, rent calculation, and bankruptcy rules.

Title: Full Manual QA and Regression Pass
Description: Perform a full, end-to-end manual test of the entire application on a release candidate build. This includes playing through multiple full games, testing all UI screens, and verifying all major features against their user stories. Document all found bugs.
Comments: This is a dedicated QA activity.
